title: Formula for Pythagorean Triples
description: All primitive Pythagorean triples (a,b,c) with a² + b² = c² are given by a = m² - n², b = 2mn, c = m² + n² for coprime m > n > 0.

meta.author: Ancient Babylonians (formalized in Lean 4 with Mathlib)

overview.historicalContext: Known to ancient Babylonians (Plimpton 322 tablet, c. 1800 BCE). The parametric formula provides a complete characterization of all integer solutions.
overview.problemStatement:
**Pythagorean Triples**:

All primitive Pythagorean triples have the form:
- $a = m^2 - n^2$
- $b = 2mn$
- $c = m^2 + n^2$

for coprime m > n > 0 with m - n odd.
overview.proofStrategy: The parametrization arises from the rational parametrization of the unit circle: any rational point (a/c, b/c) on x² + y² = 1 corresponds to the slope m/n.
keyInsights: Every primitive triple arises from some (m, n) pair
All triples are scalar multiples of primitive triples

conclusion.summary: The complete classification of Pythagorean triples is verified, connecting ancient number theory to modern algebra.
